The claim originated from social media p: suggesting that Donald Trump and the U.S. Congress had voted on a bill to end all child support in the U.S. by 11 June 2018.
These posts were identified as variants: which was created using the prank generator React365. The hoax claimed that President Trump and Congress had already ended all child support payments as of 2018.
The content of the posts was traced back: a prank generator that allows users to generate fake news and share it on social media. The website's poorly-worded disclaimer on each page clearly states that the headlines are "created by users" and should not be considered a source of information.
Legitimate news sources have not reporte: further confirming that the claim is false information generated by a prank website.
